resources.string: Food in India is an identity marker of caste, class, family, kinship, tribe affiliation, lineage, religiosity, and ethnicity.
Indian food is much more than just a collection of flavors and ingredients. It is an integral part of the country\'s history, traditions, and way of life.

Indian cuisine is known for its complex and varied use of spices, herbs, and seasonings, which have been cultivated and traded across the subcontinent for thousands of years. The food in each region of India is influenced by local ingredients, customs, and beliefs, making it a truly diverse and fascinating culinary landscape.

At the heart of Indian food culture is the concept of hospitality and sharing. Food is seen as a way to bring people together, whether it\'s through elaborate feasts during festivals and celebrations or simple meals shared with family and friends. In Indian culture, the act of cooking and feeding others is considered a labor of love, and great care is taken to ensure that guests feel welcome and well-fed.

Our app aims to honor this rich culinary heritage by bringing you authentic Indian recipes, along with insights into the cultural and historical context behind each dish. We hope that our app will inspire you to not only cook and enjoy delicious Indian food but also to appreciate the culture and traditions that make it so special.
Welcome to our Indian recipe app. Let\'s explore the\n vibrant world of Indian cuisine together
Cook with confidence using our step-by-step\n instructions and helpful tips for perfect results\n every time
From classic curries to modern\n dishes, we\'ve got you covered with our extensive\n collection of Indian recipes.

To begin making the Masala Karela Recipe 
 1- de-seed the karela and slice.Do not remove the skin as the skin has all the nutrients.
 2- Add the karela to the pressure cooker with 3 tablespoon of water; 
 3- salt and turmeric powder and pressure cook for three whistles.

 2- Add the karela to the pressure cooker with 3 tablespoon of water; 
 3- salt and turmeric powder and pressure cook for three whistles.
